entry.title: Faith
entry.summary:
Author: FyrestoneSiren

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,644Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: God, he looks beautiful.Christopher’s beside him, grinning from ear to ear. Bobby’s up front, dressed in his best suit, pretending he isn’t crying. Hen squeezes Karen’s hand. Chim’s cracking quiet jokes under his breath. Maddie, radiant, keeps looking between Buck and Eddie like she might burst.Eddie almost laughs. The whole 118, their family here, gathered for this. It’s perfect. The kind of day he never thought he’d have. The kind he didn’t dare dream about.

entry.title: [Podfic] I hummed sweet relief
entry.summary:
Author: closetfascination

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 33Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: He lets his eyes scan over to this Buckley guy and they catch on the LAFD t-shirt. Interesting. He’s lean but pretty built, not surprising for a firefighter, and tall, all leg. Together, it’s giving the impression of a Ken doll, but somehow less punchable than Eddie would expect. He doesn’t look like the kind of guy who’d have no one to pick him up at the hospital. Then again, neither does Eddie, probably. And it’s not like he has no one. So Buckley’s probably got his own list, and his own reasons he can’t call anyone on it. Eddie’s got one thing he doesn’t, though: a really fucking stupid idea. Or: Eddie meets Buck in the ER and takes him home

entry.title: The Trials And Tribulations Of Evan Buckley (A Tragedy In 101 Acts)
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_stan

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,670Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 98

Summary: Now look, Buck knew that Eddie was just angry. Maybe he didn’t even mean the words he said. But even if Eddie thought he didn’t mean it at the time, he must’ve thought it at some point in their time together, or he wouldn’t have said it. I mean come on ‘Trials And Tribulations Of Evan Buckley, A Tragedy In 97 Acts’ You can’t just make something like that up on the spot. Buck tried to convince himself it was just because Eddie watched too many Telenovelas with Chris, but then they didn’t talk about it. Sure he brought Chris back as an apology. But he never actually said he was sorry. What was he sorry about? What wasn’t he sorry about? Did he regret what he said? And if he did, which words specifically? Then Buck started to think it was true.So from that moment forward, he started to keep track. And for every selfish thing he did, he would do a selfless one to balance it out. Of course it didn’t take the team long to figure out something was wrong. Or Buck spirals about his and Eddie's fight so he tries to make up for every selfish thing he does moving forward

entry.title: i see trouble (and i want him to come my way)
entry.summary:
Author: neonweeknds

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 49,338Chapters: 7/24Kudos: 27

Summary: Buck was riding the high of his first successful solo debut, still nursing the ache of someone who walked away, when he got news that blindsided him—his upcoming solo tour wouldn’t be so solo after all. He’d be sharing the stage with Eddie Diaz, a rising country star with a mysterious past and a sound that was quickly blowing up. At first, Buck hated the idea. The last thing he wanted was to split the spotlight he’d fought so hard for. But then he actually got to know Eddie. The problem? Buck had always blurred the line between friendship and something more—and with Eddie, it was getting harder to tell the difference. or the pop star evan buckley and country singer eddie diaz slow burn angsty friends to lovers au.

entry.title: Every Story Has A Beginning, Middle, And End But Not Necessarily In That Order
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 109,545Chapters: 4/15Kudos: 79

Summary: Sometimes love doesn’t knock—it quietly moves in, settles on the couch, makes coffee in the morning, and slips into your heart when you’re too busy dancing around it to notice. And every great story has a beginning, middle, and end. But not necessarily in that order. Nothing in Eddie Diaz’s or Evan Buckley’s life has happened linearly so far, but it has occurred nevertheless. And them falling in love with one another is not another exception. OR: There are better no roommates than Evan Buckley and Eddie Diaz, and there is no state more natural for the pair of best friends than living together under one roof. They have a routine, you see. One they had down before they even lived together, but now that they do, it's like second nature. Buck, Eddie, and Christopher have a long summer ahead of them living in one house. And it’s a season filled with: Kitchen mishaps and New Recipes Barbecues and Family Love Zoo visits and Science Camps Heat Waves and Ballroom Dancing A love confession. Or Two? Stolen glances, Secret kisses in their dreams Dangerous Calls That Threaten To Put Everything In Peril And so, so much more...

entry.title: gave me the blues and then purple pink skies
entry.summary:
Author: sayitwithyourhands

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,585Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 160

Summary: Eddie's fingers twitch at his sides, curling into fists until his nails bite his palms, chasing the sharpness on purpose, because pain is a thing he can measure. And maybe the red crescents on his palms can chase away the ache in his chest, can silence the beast that lives behind his ribs, clawing desperately for a control that isn’t there to be had. "I was counting inches while you were standing inside of them.” Eddie drags a hand over his mouth, knuckles pressed hard like he can push the words back in, but they’re coming now. He can’t stop them. “I was doing the math on how many stitches it would take to close your face and trying not to think about how fast you bleed. And you came home with fucking show-and-tell.”   or; a 9x02 coda in which buck brings home the clipboard

entry.title: Bound by Smoke, Claimed by Blood
entry.summary:
Author: Raeili64

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,435Chapters: 10/20Kudos: 333

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley runs into fire for a living. It’s what he’s good at—charging into chaos, finding the lost, and carrying them back into the light. When a call brings him face-to-face with Christopher Diaz, a boy trapped in the flames, Buck doesn’t hesitate. He pulls him out. He saves him.What Buck doesn’t expect is Christopher’s father.Eddie Diaz isn’t just a single dad. He’s a mob boss with blood on his hands, power at his back, and an obsession that sparks the moment he sees the firefighter who carried his son to safety. Gratitude twists into something sharper, darker. Eddie doesn’t just want Buck safe—he wants Buck his.Now Buck finds himself watched, followed, pulled into a world of shadows and violence he never asked for. But when accelerant burns through Christopher’s home and enemies send messages in fire, Buck realizes he’s already part of the war Eddie lives in.One saved child.One look across smoke.And nothing will ever be the same.

entry.title: Firelight and Blaze
entry.summary:
Author: Ackorna

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,558Chapters: 8/21Kudos: 3

Summary: Buck is a firefighter by day and Blaze — a confident, masked performer — by night. After a controversial suspension from LAFD for his off-duty performances, Buck faces both institutional and public scrutiny. With his team at Station 118, Buck navigates the fallout: media storms, HQ investigations, and social backlash. Yet through solidarity, wit, and raw authenticity, Buck becomes a symbol of courage, not just in the field but in living unapologetically. Meanwhile, Eddie stands as his quiet anchor, Christopher as their shared joy, and the 118 rallies around him in defiance of hypocrisy. Together, they redefine what it means to serve — on duty, off duty, and in the eyes of the world.
